update.description:
This includes the modifications done for getting actor animation working. Please refer #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/538/gazebo-actor-sdf-13-parser-error for more details.

**Tested for:**
gazebo worlds/actor.world
turltebot simulator + RViz

**Known issues:**
If the actor skin file is set to sub_16.dae, walk.dae, stand.dae, talk_a.dae, talk_b.dae or run.dae, it renders the actor very weird. **Workaround** is to specify a working DAE (moonwalk.dae, sit_down.dae, sitting.dae and stand_up.dae) for <skin><filename> and load your desired animation DAE in <animation><filename>. It looks like the scale of the armature and mesh for not working DAEs are not same. Probably this may be an existing armature scaling issue.
update.title: Fix actor animation loading and rendering issues

pullrequest.title: Fix actor animation loading and rendering issues

content.raw: This also causes a non crashing error message ("Unable to find value for key[allow_auto_disable]"). If we set this based on the existence of the element "allow_auto_disable", not sure whether we need to initialize it here to a default value or in inherited classes of Link base class.
content.html: This also causes a non crashing error message ("Unable to find value for key[allow_auto_disable]"). If we set this based on the existence of the element "allow_auto_disable", not sure whether we need to initialize it here to a default value or in inherited classes of Link base class.

pull_request.title: Fix actor animation loading and rendering issues

pullrequest.title: Fix actor animation loading and rendering issues

content.html:
Actually there is a 'static' ATTRIBUTE in Actor.sdf. That is why 

this->SetStatic(this->sdf->Get<bool>("static"));

doesn't pop up an error message. But there is no 'static' ELEMENT. I am not sure whether is correct to define 'static' as an ATTRIBUTE in actor.sdf and while it is being an ELEMENT in model.sdf in the first place.

pull_request.title: Fix actor animation loading and rendering issues

pullrequest.title: Fix actor animation loading and rendering issues

content.html:
This implementation causes a error message. Could you please change lines 70-76 (note that this removes the comment) to be:

if (this->sdf->HasElement("static"))
{ 
  this->sdf->GetElement("static")->GetValue()->SetUpdateFunc(
    boost::bind(&Entity::IsStatic, this));
}

It looks like the scale of the armature and mesh for not working DAEs are not same. Probably this may be an existing armature scaling issue.

content.raw: Fixed that!  Now the merged solution works fine. Tested for gazebo worlds/actor.world. However turtlebot simulator doesn't run / recompiled with newer Gazebo headers. May be gazebo_ros_pkgs will need modifications to comply with latest Gazebo (4.0), works fine with 3.1 though.
content.html: Fixed that! Now the merged solution works fine. Tested for gazebo worlds/actor.world. However turtlebot simulator doesn't run / recompiled with newer Gazebo headers. May be gazebo_ros_pkgs will need modifications to comply with latest Gazebo (4.0), works fine with 3.1 though.

content.raw: Hi Nathan, Initially I forked at version 3.1 and my modifications solved the actor animation issues. Now after merging with Gazebo default, Collada file is not loaded. There have been considerable changes from 3.1 to current specially for ColladaLoader.cc. As I tracked down so far issue is in somewhere in ColladaLoader::LoadPolylist(). I will try to get that fixed. Any suggestion?
content.html: Hi Nathan, Initially I forked at version 3.1 and my modifications solved the actor animation issues. Now after merging with Gazebo default, Collada file is not loaded. There have been considerable changes from 3.1 to current specially for ColladaLoader.cc. As I tracked down so far issue is in somewhere in ColladaLoader::LoadPolylist(). I will try to get that fixed. Any suggestion?

content.raw:
Should we decline your other pull request in favor of this one?

Also, could you fix the conflicts? I believe you can run the following in your fork:

`hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo`

`hg merge default`
content.html:
Should we decline your other pull request in favor of this one?

Also, could you fix the conflicts? I believe you can run the following in your fork:

hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo

hg merge default
